body: I have the same problem, but not the xy&wh, my cls loss is 0. I think my label file has no wrong, because it work well on Darknet implement.

@hxy1051653358 this likely means you have no targets found, check your nTargets column. This means that the system is not able to find your labels correctly.

@wangm27 cls loss 0 is expected for single class training.
@hxy1051653358 yes it looks like it is finding your labels then. The problem must be in your label format. Please visit https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

@glenn-jocher I think my label format is correct as above，so I don't understand the problem. When I run the program step by step, I can see that x, y, w, and h have values, but the final result is xy and wh is 0.

@hxy1051653358 I also have this problem. Have you found the reason? Wh = 0, but XY has a value.

Epoch       Batch   GIoU/xy        wh       obj       cls     total   targets  img_size
   1/299       23/23     0.115         0      3.56      5.93       9.6         4       608: 100%|██████████| 24/24 [00:11<00:00,  2.73it/s]
                         Class    Images   Targets         P         R       mAP        F1: 100%|██████████| 24/24
@hxy1051653358 this is normal, GIoU loss is used now in place of xy and wh losses. You can train with -xywh to use those losses intead.

I am training my costume data and all wh loss values are zero I am testing small dataset just to make sure I can make it work with the repo. for one class what loss i should expect? because I get following results:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43985794/61577156-4d1fcc00-aadb-11e9-926e-884ca00afaba.png)
the total loss is decreasing as well as GIoU/xy 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43985794/61577179-ae479f80-aadb-11e9-83fa-963f1ee40c3f.png)
would you advise me on getting zero values for wh. I havent run the test.py yet. Do you recommend to run it first before train.py? I know we can train without test.py however I am wondering about the outcomes. Thank you in advance for your comments.

somewhere in issues, I read that the class loss should be 0 for a single class. but mine is not zero. I checked the train batch images they look fine and bounding boxes are correct. My concern is about wh loss values and cls loss values.

@sanazss  wh loss of zero is normal as GIoU loss is the default box regression loss now. 

cls loss is only zero if CELoss is used. BCELoss will produce nonzero losses for cls.
